Package game

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.GameController
  • class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The 'Engine' of the game. Controls the clock, updates Updatable, and renders PhysicalEntitys. For rendering, we have two canvas layers: one for Beings and one for StillObject. We re-render every Being on every frame. But we only re-render a Tile's StillObject when requested.

      private javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext objectsGc
      The GraphicsContext of one of a layer.
      private java.util.HashSet<Tile> renderQueue
      A set of Tile whose StillObject needs to be re-rendered in the next frame.
      private GameLoopTimer timer
      The clock that time our updating and rendering
      private java.util.HashSet<Updatable> updatableEntities
      A set of all Updatable in the game.

        Prepare the controller.

    • Method Detail

      • addEntity

        protected void addEntity​(Entity entity)
        If the given entity is Updatable, add it to updatableEntities;
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to be added.

      • removeEntity

        protected void removeEntity​(Entity entity)
        If the given entity is Updatable, remove it from updatableEntities;
        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to be removed.

      • updateUpdatables

        private void updateUpdatables​(double ticksPassed)
        Run Updatable.update(double) on each entity in updatableEntities.
        Parameters:
        ticksPassed - The amount of ticks that passed since last frame. 1 tick always equal 16.67ms (even in non-60fps scenarios).

      • render

        private void render()
        Render a frame.
        • Redraw the object in each tile in the renderQueue.
        • Redraw every being in allBeings

      • queueTileRender

        protected void queueTileRender​(Tile tile)
        Add tile to the renderQueue.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile whose object should be re-rendered.

      • onTick

        private void onTick​(double ticksPassed)
        Run updateUpdatables(double) and render() for a frame.
        Parameters:
        ticksPassed - The amount of ticks that passed since last frame. 1 tick always equal 16.67ms (even in non-60fps scenarios).

      • start

        protected void start()
        Start the timer.

      • stop

        protected void stop()
        Destroy the timer.

      • pause

        protected void pause()
        Pause the timer.

      • resume

        protected void resume()
        Resume the timer.

      • isActive

        protected boolean isActive()
        Check if the timer is still alive. Returns false if stop() has been called.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the timer has been destroyed.
